title: Glasgow's Lord Provost urged to quit after spending £8,000 of taxpayers' money on shoes and clothes
text:
Glasgow's Lord Provost is under pressure to resign after it emerged she has charged the taxpayer £8,000 for clothes, shoes, and beauty products.

Labour and the Tories said Eva Bolander should pay back the money and stand down after making expense claims for 23 pairs of shoes, six jackets, five coats, underwear and a £200 designer hat.

The SNP councillor also made claims for make-up, £751 of haircuts and £358 of pampering that included getting her toenails painted.

The city council hands the Lord Provost a "civic allowance" of up to £5,000 a year for personal expenses she incurs while representing Glasgow at events and functions.

But opposition parties said the spending was "grotesque" in a city...
description: Glasgow's Lord Provost is under pressure to resign after it emerged she has charged the taxpayer £8,000 for clothes, shoes, and beauty products.
